intro: Pilosella virentisquama, commonly known as the green-leafed pilosella, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and meadows. Its leaves are covered in fine, soft hairs, giving it a distinctive, fuzzy appearance. It produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months.
